{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Database Administrator (DBA)",
  "description": "Afripoint Group is a leading technology solutions provider focused on delivering innovative products and services across various sectors. We are driven by a commitment to excellence and creativity, providing world-class solutions to our clients. At Afripoint Group, we value collaboration, forward-thinking, and a passion for pushing the boundaries of design to create exceptional user experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Database Administrator (DBA)

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Afripoint Group Limited is seeking an experienced Database Administrator (DBA) to manage, secure, and optimize company databases, ensuring high availability, performance, and data integrity across business-critical systems.


Key Responsibilities


	Install, configure, manage, and monitor databases
	Perform regular database backups, recovery, and replication
	Ensure database security, integrity, and availability
	Optimize performance and resolve database-related issues
	Support development and operations teams with database needs


Requirements


	Minimum of 3&ndash;5 years of experience as a Database Administrator
	Strong knowledge of SQL and database platforms (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, or Oracle)
	Experience with database performance tuning and troubleshooting
	Familiarity with Linux/Unix environments
	Strong analytical and documentation skills


Certifications (Added Advantage):


	Oracle Certified Professional (OCP)
	Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator
	AWS Certified Database &ndash; Specialty
	Any relevant database or cloud certification


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@afripointgroup.com&nbsp;using &quot;Database Administrator (DBA) &ndash; Afripoint Group&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2026-03-04",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": ""
    
  },

}



Database Administrator (DBA) Job at Afripoint Group




        
    

        
        Afripoint Group is a leading technology solutions provider focused on delivering innovative products and services across various sectors. We are driven by a commitment to excellence and creativity, providing world-class solutions to our clients. At Afripoint Group, we value collaboration, forward-thinking, and a passion for pushing the boundaries of design to create exceptional user experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Database Administrator (DBA)

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Afripoint Group Limited is seeking an experienced Database Administrator (DBA) to manage, secure, and optimize company databases, ensuring high availability, performance, and data integrity across business-critical systems.


Key Responsibilities


	Install, configure, manage, and monitor databases
	Perform regular database backups, recovery, and replication
	Ensure database security, integrity, and availability
	Optimize performance and resolve database-related issues
	Support development and operations teams with database needs


Requirements


	Minimum of 3–5 years of experience as a Database Administrator
	Strong knowledge of SQL and database platforms (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, or Oracle)
	Experience with database performance tuning and troubleshooting
	Familiarity with Linux/Unix environments
	Strong analytical and documentation skills


Certifications (Added Advantage):


	Oracle Certified Professional (OCP)
	Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator
	AWS Certified Database – Specialty
	Any relevant database or cloud certification


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@afripointgroup.com using "Database Administrator (DBA) – Afripoint Group" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Personal Assistant to the Managing Director",
  "description": "Afripoint Group is a leading technology solutions provider focused on delivering innovative products and services across various sectors. We are driven by a commitment to excellence and creativity, providing world-class solutions to our clients. At Afripoint Group, we value collaboration, forward-thinking, and a passion for pushing the boundaries of design to create exceptional user experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant to the Managing Director

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Afripoint Group Limited is seeking a highly organized and proactive Personal Assistant to the Managing Director to provide administrative, scheduling, and confidential support to the MD.
	The ideal candidate must be detail-oriented, professional, and able to manage multiple priorities effectively.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the MD&rsquo;s schedule, meetings, and correspondence
	Handle confidential documents and information with discretion
	Coordinate travel, meetings, and internal communications
	Prepare reports, presentations, and meeting briefs
	Liaise with internal teams and external stakeholders


Requirements


	Proven experience as a PA or Executive Assistant
	Strong organizational and time-management skills
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	High level of professionalism and confidentiality
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and productivity tools.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@afripointgroup.com&nbsp;using &quot;PA to MD Application &ndash; Afripoint Group&quot;&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.",

Personal Assistant to the Managing Director Job at Afripoint Group




        
    

        
        Afripoint Group is a leading technology solutions provider focused on delivering innovative products and services across various sectors. We are driven by a commitment to excellence and creativity, providing world-class solutions to our clients. At Afripoint Group, we value collaboration, forward-thinking, and a passion for pushing the boundaries of design to create exceptional user experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant to the Managing Director

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Afripoint Group Limited is seeking a highly organized and proactive Personal Assistant to the Managing Director to provide administrative, scheduling, and confidential support to the MD.
	The ideal candidate must be detail-oriented, professional, and able to manage multiple priorities effectively.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the MD’s schedule, meetings, and correspondence
	Handle confidential documents and information with discretion
	Coordinate travel, meetings, and internal communications
	Prepare reports, presentations, and meeting briefs
	Liaise with internal teams and external stakeholders


Requirements


	Proven experience as a PA or Executive Assistant
	Strong organizational and time-management skills
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	High level of professionalism and confidentiality
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and productivity tools.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@afripointgroup.com using "PA to MD Application – Afripoint Group" as the subject of the mail.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Pharmacist",
  "description": "Kelina Hospital is a surgical hospital, with a focus on Minimally Invasive Surgery. Kelina was the first private hospital in Nigeria to do Laser Lithotripsy for Kidney Stones (PCNL, RIRS, 2011), Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy, LRP (2012), and Holmium Laser Enucleation of the Prostate (HoLEP, 2018). Kelina does Laparoscopic Surgery in General Surgery, Urology, Gynaecology amongst others. HoLEP, LRP, PCNL, RIRS are the most common surgeries we do each week.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Pharmacist

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
To be eligible, candidates&nbsp;must:


	Be resident in Lagos.
	Have post-NYSC job experience and registration with PCN.
	Be highly computer-literate.


Remuneration
Not less than N4,000,000 per annum.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should:Click here to apply online
Or
Send their CV, application letter, scanned copies of certificates, and scanned passport-sized photograph of the candidate via email to:&nbsp;jobs@lagos.kelinahospital.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note:&nbsp;Only applications that follow the above steps will be considered.",

Pharmacist Job at Kelina Hospital




        
    

        
        Kelina Hospital is a surgical hospital, with a focus on Minimally Invasive Surgery. Kelina was the first private hospital in Nigeria to do Laser Lithotripsy for Kidney Stones (PCNL, RIRS, 2011), Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy, LRP (2012), and Holmium Laser Enucleation of the Prostate (HoLEP, 2018). Kelina does Laparoscopic Surgery in General Surgery, Urology, Gynaecology amongst others. HoLEP, LRP, PCNL, RIRS are the most common surgeries we do each week.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Pharmacist

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
To be eligible, candidates must:
     

            
    




	Be resident in Lagos.
	Have post-NYSC job experience and registration with PCN.
	Be highly computer-literate.


Remuneration
Not less than N4,000,000 per annum.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should:Click here to apply online
Or
Send their CV, application letter, scanned copies of certificates, and scanned passport-sized photograph of the candidate via email to: jobs@lagos.kelinahospital.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only applications that follow the above steps will be considered.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Architect",
  "description": "Prestigious Homes Limited is a luxury home builder, delivering homes to their owners just the way they envisioned it. We create incredible majestic homes with superior craftsmanship, exquisite architectural designs, and the finest interior finishing. We expand our clients&rsquo; imagination to countless features and details that bear a distinctive elegance and sophistication. We believe every building must be environmentally friendly and green, and our clients come back with smiles.

There is nothing quite like a luxury PHL home. From the bold architectural designs with the finest interior finishes to the incredibly energy-efficient home plans in the most prestigious locations. We take luxury living to an unparalleled height. Our craftsmanship, first-class features, unsurpassed attention to detail and innovative energy efficiencies have also been recognized time again with numerous accolades.

With PHL, every project is unique and we do not rest on our oars until we deliver that dream of yours. Because your money is hard-earned, we ensure through discipline that we deliver value that will exceed your expectations at whatever level you commit us. We are indeed your invaluable partner in realizing your real estate dreams and the ideal choice for your home development. Our team will sit with you, hear you out, understand you and birth your imagination.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Architect
Job Locations:&nbsp;Lekki, Ikoyi, and Victoria Island Environs, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Design residential and commercial building projects.
	Prepare architectural drawings and specifications
	Work closely with engineers, QS, and site teams
	Ensure designs meet regulatory and aesthetic standards.


Requirements


	B.Sc / M.Sc in Architecture
	Minimum of 4 - 5 years of professional experience
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit, SketchUp, or similar tools
	Experience in real estate development projects.


Renumeration
Open to negotiation/discussion during interview.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@prestigioushomeslimited.com&nbsp;and copy (cc):&nbsp;chisom.onwudinjo@prestigioushomeslimited.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as subject of the mail.

Note


	For further enquiries, call: 07074863616
	Shortlisted candidates will be invited for a one off physical interview with 72 hours prior notice.
",
  "datePosted": "2026-02-03",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-18",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Prestigious Homes Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",

      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Architect Job at Prestigious Homes Limited




        
    

        
        Prestigious Homes Limited is a luxury home builder, delivering homes to their owners just the way they envisioned it. We create incredible majestic homes with superior craftsmanship, exquisite architectural designs, and the finest interior finishing. We expand our clients’ imagination to countless features and details that bear a distinctive elegance and sophistication. We believe every building must be environmentally friendly and green, and our clients come back with smiles.
     

            
    



There is nothing quite like a luxury PHL home. From the bold architectural designs with the finest interior finishes to the incredibly energy-efficient home plans in the most prestigious locations. We take luxury living to an unparalleled height. Our craftsmanship, first-class features, unsurpassed attention to detail and innovative energy efficiencies have also been recognized time again with numerous accolades.

With PHL, every project is unique and we do not rest on our oars until we deliver that dream of yours. Because your money is hard-earned, we ensure through discipline that we deliver value that will exceed your expectations at whatever level you commit us. We are indeed your invaluable partner in realizing your real estate dreams and the ideal choice for your home development. Our team will sit with you, hear you out, understand you and birth your imagination.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Architect
Job Locations: Lekki, Ikoyi, and Victoria Island Environs, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Design residential and commercial building projects.
	Prepare architectural drawings and specifications
	Work closely with engineers, QS, and site teams
	Ensure designs meet regulatory and aesthetic standards.


Requirements


	B.Sc / M.Sc in Architecture
	Minimum of 4 - 5 years of professional experience
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit, SketchUp, or similar tools
	Experience in real estate development projects.


Renumeration
Open to negotiation/discussion during interview.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@prestigioushomeslimited.com and copy (cc): chisom.onwudinjo@prestigioushomeslimited.com using the Job Position as subject of the mail.

Note


	For further enquiries, call: 07074863616
	Shortlisted candidates will be invited for a one off physical interview with 72 hours prior notice.
    

    

        Click here to Apply
